page.title: 15The Alderney Lifeboat I
page.content: There was a {lifeboat}previously from 1869 to 1884. It was never launched and a crew could not be raised. The reason the {lifeboat}arrived a year ago is because figures taken over a 5 year period and a shift of shipping lanes and an increase in visiting yachts indicated a need for a{ {lifeboat.}It was built by Lochin Marine, Rye, Sussex. It cost Â£200,000. This was donated by Ancient Order of{ {Foresters} who paid Â£60,000, Belice Trust Â£20,000, Major Vernon donated Â£5,000, Dunlop Employees charity Â£1,000 .The rest came from the{RNLI funds. The first {Coxwain}is Steve Shaw. There are 14 {crew,}generally 4_5 0n each service. Practies are held once a week. They are trained firstly at the head quarters in Poole,Dorset. Further training is by the boat's officers. Inshore foul weather gear is
